content: cow parsley afghan square by lettice rose inspired by queen anne s lace scarf by joyce lewis she kindly allowed me to adapt it into an afghan square cow parsley is our local name for the same plant somewhat mundane but this is a blanket square not your fine fancy lace the square is made up of a central round medallion of four rounds the six petals are worked individually in row and then the background is added the petals overlap each other so it is important when stitching the base of the petals to the central medallion that you pay attention to whether the stitches go in front of or behind the previously formed petals all will be clear as you do it please note there will be round 1 and also petal row 1 etc materials sample was made using stylecraft special dk and a 4mm hook yarn colour a background meadow green yarn colour b flower parchment six removable stitch markers or contrasting yarn for marking stitches size fine dk with an e/4/3 5mm hook comes up 9 25 heavy dk with a g/6/4mm hook comes up 9 75 worsted weight with an h/8/5mm hook comes up 12 all sizes are approximate 2015 lettice rose cow parsley afghan square page 1 of 4 stitches used us crochet terms chain stitch chain-5 when starting a round instructions central medallion using colour a form a sliding circle or chain 6 slip_stitch to form a ring round 1 chain 4 as first treble_crochet 23 treble_crochet into ring slip_stitch to top of beginning chain-4 to close 24 treble_crochet fasten_off round 2 some crocheters seem to get the bobbles landing automatically on the right side some don t if yours end up on the wrong side either pull them through with a hook or if you are having a hard time turn your work and do round 4 from the wrong side which you may find easier attach colour b with single_crochet into any treble_crochet treble_crochet into same stitch single_crochet treble_crochet into each of next 23 treble_crochet slip_stitch to first single_crochet to join 24 single_crochet 24 treble_crochet fasten_off round 3 attach colour a with slip_stitch into any single_crochet chain 5 skip next treble_crochet double_crochet in next single_crochet chain 2 23 times slip_stitch to 3rd chain of beginning chain-5 24 double_crochet 24 chain-2 sps round 4 slip_stitch into next chain-2 space chain 5 single_crochet chain 4 into each of next 23 chain-2 sps slip_stitch into base of starting chain to join 24 single_crochet 24 chain-4 spaces fasten_off you will now have the central medallion motif you may need to just tweak each bobble with a hook to make it stand out properly
